item.dc:creator: Jayson Stark
item.title: Philadelphia Phillies signal Cliff Lee trade may be imminent
item.description: There were more indications Wednesday that the Phillies' pursuit of Indians pitcher Cliff Lee is heating up.

item.dc:creator: Ed Werder
item.title: Brett Favre tells Minnesota Vikings he'll remain retired
item.description: After nearly three months of what he described as intense and often emotional soul-searching, Brett Favre decided to remain retired from the NFL rather than become the Minnesota Vikings' starting quarterback.

item.dc:creator: Sal Paolantonio
item.title: Plaxico Burress will testify before grand jury, his attorney says
item.description: Former Giants wide receiver Plaxico Burress, who faces a weapons charge for shooting himself in the thigh at a nightclub last year, arrived for his testimony Wednesday before a Manhattan grand jury.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Buehrle sets MLB record, loses on Twins' rally
item.description: Coming off the 18th perfect game in major league history, Chicago White Sox pitcher Mark Buehrle retired the first 17 batters on Tuesday night to set a record with 45 outs in a row before the Minnesota Twins rallied for a 5-3 victory over the White Sox.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Philadelphia Eagles assistant Jim Johnson succumbs to cancer
item.description: Jim Johnson, whose attacking defenses helped the Eagles to one Super Bowl appearance and five NFC title games, has died. He was 68.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Tony Dungy believes Michael Vick focused on putting life back together
item.description: Tony Dungy says he believes Michael Vick is focused on putting his life back together.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Kazmir outduels Sabathia as Rays stop Yankees
item.description: Scott Kazmir outpitched CC Sabathia to win for the first time in more than two months and the Rays slowed down the streaking Yankees with a 6-2 victory.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Felipe Massa of Ferrari set to leave intensive care after taking first steps since crash
item.description: Ferrari's Felipe Massa will leave intensive care on Wednesday after taking his first steps since he fractured his skull in a crash at last weekend's Hungarian Grand Prix, the Formula One team said.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Mary Descenza of United States sets record in 200m butterfly at swimming world championships
item.description: Mary Descenza, who failed to qualify for the Beijing Games, set the 16th world record of the swimming championships in the preliminaries of the 200-meter butterfly.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: NFLPA executive director DeMaurice Smith: Roger Goodell's disciplinary authority will be subject of talks
item.description: The NFL players' union wants to talk about commissioner Roger Goodell's power to discipline players when talks on a new collective bargaining agreement begin, union chief executive DeMaurice Smith said.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Alberto Contador: My relationship with Lance Armstrong is 'zero'
item.description: Alberto Contador and Lance Armstrong are sniping again after a fragile truce during the Tour de France.
